org.forgerock.openig.header

Interface Header

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Indexed<String>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConnectionHeader, ContentEncodingHeader, ContentLengthHeader, ContentTypeHeader, CookieHeader, LocationHeader, OAuth2BearerWWWAuthenticateHeader

    public interface Header
extends Indexed<String>
    An HTTP message header.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void fromMessage(Message<?> message)
      Populates the content of the header from the specified message.
      void fromString(String string)
      Populates the content of the header from the specified string value.
      String getKey()
      Returns the name of the header, as it would canonically appear within an HTTP message.
      void toMessage(Message<?> message)
      Sets the header in the specified message.
      String toString()
      Returns the header as a single string value.

    • Method Detail

      • getKey

        String getKey()
        Returns the name of the header, as it would canonically appear within an HTTP message.
        Specified by:
        getKey in interface Indexed<String>
        Returns:
        The name of the header, as it would canonically appear within an HTTP message.

      • fromMessage

        void fromMessage(Message<?> message)
        Populates the content of the header from the specified message. If the message does not contain the appropriate header, calling this message has no effect (will not change the values of the header).
        Parameters:
        message - The message to get the content of the header from.

      • fromString

        void fromString(String string)
        Populates the content of the header from the specified string value.
        Parameters:
        string - The string to populate the content of the header from.

      • toMessage

        void toMessage(Message<?> message)
        Sets the header in the specified message. If the header is empty, calling this method has no effect (will not erase existing instances of the header in the message).
        Parameters:
        message - The message to which add the current header.

      • toString

        String toString()
        Returns the header as a single string value. If the header is empty, this method will return null.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        The header as a single string value or null if empty.
